title: Locke raises just this objection, that we have no way of knowing that we have listed all possible hypotheses. But without that assumption, he argues, an eliminative argument proves nothing. See Locke, Examination, 214. 15 This is Foucher’s objection. Malebranche’s argument simply assumes, he objects, that we are capable of knowledge of external objects. Without that assumption, his argument for the Vision in God proves nothing
